ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: I spent more hours in this class than I did in anyother.
I spent at least 6 hours per week on this class. There is a TON of reading, but it is all really interesting.
4 hours
This course requires a huge amount of work -- usually all-day Saturday and all-day Sunday, every week.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This class is very informative and interesting. There is a lot of reading. The reading is very important to the discussion, so the weakness is that there is so much reading. However, the strength of the class is also the value and extensiveness of the reading.

Awesome course. Best I've taken at YSPH. Shelly really cares about the students and it shows. She has stripped her own ego from its delivery and created an incredibly open, honest yet intellectual environment.Weakness: Too much reading which compromised my ability to do work for other courses. Sometimes I wish our discussions were a bit more structured.Strength: I really learned a lot about the topic because I was forced to do so much reading. Shelly is awesome in so many ways. Having us over to her house at the end was really marvelous. She is a wonderful facilitator, mentor, teacher, professor. Bravo!
This was a really great course for people who are interested in health disparities. Too much work for people who are not.

This is one of the best courses I've taken at Yale, or anywhere. I learned so much, and genuinely enjoyed coming to class. I have just a few points about what might be improved to make this class even better.There is a TON of reading, and although it's really interesting, I think some of it could be eliminated.Each week students are assigned to lead discussion, but as discussion moves forward, it rarely comes back to the students who have spent time preparing to lead it. Either bring the discussion back to these students or don't make them prepare to lead discussion.Having some speakers would be great - even if they're outside of class time and optional.
Great course. Lots of work, but interesting material.

Strengths: engaging, interesting, and worthwhile! definitely the best class I have taken while at Yale. Class discussions were great, and the small class size allowed students to get to know the professor and others in the class. You walk out of the class with a comprehensive and deep understanding of health disparities.Weaknesses: the workload, while worthwhile, was huge. This compromised my ability to do work for other classes. Having discussion leaders wasn't always useful.
FABULOUS class! I wish I had taken this class earlier, it would have definitely shaped my coursework differently.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Shelley Geballe  See above.
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  She is very passionate about the topic and it comes through in the course.

Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Shelley is really a joy to learn from and talk with. She is incredibly knowledgeable, and an amazing role model for what public health students might be able to do in the future.
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Professor Geballe was clearly an expert on the topic and made the course interesting every class.

Instructor: Shelley Geballe  The instructor was extremely passionate about the subject and cared more about the students in the class than any professor I have encountered at Yale. She was always available to meet with students and more-than-willing to mentor them. She was always organized and well-prepared for class.
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Wonderful teacher. It's nice to have a professor that practices what she preaches.
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  great professor who knows how to teach a real policy class in a practical way

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: An in-depth analysis of health disparities. Expect to work really hard andgain an equal amount. Strongly recommend.
This is a fantastic class, and will really open your eyes to a lot of things that cause public health problems that you might not have thought of. This class is definitely one not to miss.
I would definitely recommend this course for anyone interested in public health.
An INCREDIBLE course for anyone with an interest in health disparities. Though the workload is great, it is the best course I have taken at Yale and I would highly recommend it to everyone.
I would tell EVERYONE to take this class, but I wouldn't want it to get too big. I believe that our class was so great because it was a small class.
